citation.article-title: Desulfotomaculum kuznetsovii sp. nov., a new spore-forming thermophilic sulfate-reducing bacterium.

p.s: Description of Desulfotomaculum kuznetsovii sp. nov.
Desulfotomaculum kuznetsovii (named in honor of the leading Soviet microbiologist, S. I. Kuznetsov, who has made a significant contribution to the study of the geochemical activity of microorganisms)
Straight rods, 1.0-1.4 x 3.5-5 μm in dimensions, with rounded ends.
Motile by means of peritrichous flagella.
Spindle- or lemon-shaped cells are encountered.
Spores spherical, 1.3 μm in diameter, situated centrally and causing swelling of the cells.
Gas vacuoles are absent.
Gram-negative, although the cell wall has a Gram-positive structure.
Chemoorganotrophs and chemolithoautotrophs, exhibiting a respiratory or fermentative metabolism.
Formate, acetate, propionate, butyrate, methanol, ethanol, propanol butanol, lactate, and pyruvate are utilized as carbon and energy sources, and these compounds are oxidized to CO2.

In addition salts of valeric, caproic, caprylic, palmitic and malate, succinate, and fumarate are utilized, and the organism can grow for more than three-four successive subcultures on H2 + CO2 in the absence of organic carbon.

No growth in media containing citrate, oxalate, benzoate, para-aminobenzoate, phenol, acetone, methyl ethyl ketone, isopropanol, glucose fructose maltose, sucrose, alanine, valinine, threonine, or glutamic acid.
Sulfate, sulfite, and thiosulfate serve as electron acceptors and are reduced to sufide.
Elemental sulfur, oxygen, and NO3- are not reduced.
Pyruvate and fumarate are fermented.
Molecular nitrogen is not fixed.
Obligate anaerobes.
Grow when reducing agents (sulfide, dithionite) are present in the medium.
No requirement for vitamins, sodium chloride, or growth factors.
The organism grows in the temperature range of 50 to 85°C with a temperature optimum of 60-65°C.
Highest quantities of H2S are formed in media containing no NaCl, and growth is found in the presence of no more than 2-3% NaCl.
The cells contain cytochrome b and sulfite reductase P582.
The GC base content in the DNA is 49 mol%.
Source of isolation: underground thermal mineral waters.
The type strain No. 17 has been deposited in the All-Union Culture Collection of Microorganisms, Moscow.
